intro: Paepalanthus sessiliflorus var. sessiliflorus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved puya, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and striking inflorescence. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. The leaves are thick and waxy, adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat.
